title: Welcome to My Course Assessment Portal
text:
Welcome to the Universiti Teknologi MARA (UiTM) Kedah Branch Campus Continuous Assessment Portal! As an esteemed educator at UiTM Kedah, I am dedicated to providing the utmost support and transparency in the academic journey of our students.

At UiTM Kedah, we pride ourselves on fostering an environment of excellence, innovation, and inclusivity. With a rich history of academic prowess and a commitment to holistic education, our campus stands as a beacon of knowledge and opportunity in the region.

This webpage serves as a central hub for accessing continuous assessment marks for all courses taught at UiTM Kedah. As an integral part of our commitment to academic integrity and student success, we believe in providing timely and accessible feedback to our students. Through this portal, students can track their progress, identify areas for improvement, and engage actively in their learning journey.

As an educator, I am passionate about empowering my students to reach their full potential. With a focus on fostering critical thinking, creativity, and lifelong learning skills, my goal is to cultivate a supportive learning environment where every student can thrive.

I invite you to explore this portal, engage with your continuous assessment marks, and utilize the resources available to support your academic growth. Together, let us embark on a journey of discovery, learning, and achievement at Universiti Teknologi MARA Kedah Branch Campus.

Thank you for choosing UiTM Kedah, where excellence is not just a goal but a way of life.

Sincerely,
Kamarul Ariffin
Senior Lecturer,
Universiti Teknologi MARA Kedah Branch Campus

title: Sample Final Examination Feb 2024
text:
r = 10%
d = 9%
Proceed, P = RM14,358.17
Date of the note = 11 January 2022
discount term = 30 days

a)

\[
\begin{align}
Proceed &= S(1 - dt) \\
14,358.17 &= S(1 - 0.09(\frac{30}{360})) \\
S &= RM14,466.67
\end{align}
\]






Note



We use proceeds formula to determine the value pf S (maturity value) since the proceed value was given. In addition, the discount term is 30 days since it is stated that the note was discounted 30 days before the maturity date.


b)

\[
\begin{align}
D &= S - Proceeds \\
&= 14,466.67 - 14,358.17 \\
&= RM108.50
\end{align}
\]



P = RM4,000
k = 6%
m = 2 (compounded semi-annually)
t = 3 years

Add a a saving of RM5,000 after two years from the initial deposit

Solution 1
\[
\begin{align}
S_1 &= P(1 + i)^n \\
&= 4,000\bigg(1 + \frac{0.06}{2}\bigg)^4 \\
&= RM4,502.04 \\
\\
Add\ another\ RM5,000 \\
New\ P &= 4,502.04 + 5,000 \\
&= RM9,502.04 \\
\\
S &= New\ P(1 + i)^n \\
&= 9,502.04\bigg(1 + \frac{0.06}{2}\bigg)^2 \\
&= RM10,080.71
\end{align}
\] Solution 2
\[
\begin{align}
S &= (P(1 + i)^{n_1} + 5,000)(1 + i)^{n_2}\\
&= \bigg(4,000\bigg(1 + \frac{0.06}{2}\bigg)^4 + 5,000\bigg)\bigg(1 + \frac{0.06}{2}\bigg)^2 \\
&= RM10,080.71
\end{align}
\]



DP = RM35,000
t = 25 years
m = 12 (monthly)
R = RM1,580
k = 4.9%
n = 12(25) = 300

a)
\[
\begin{align}
A &= R\bigg[\frac{1 - (1 + i)^{-n}}{i}\bigg]\\
&= 1,580\bigg[\frac{1 - \bigg(1 + \bigg(\frac{0.049}{12}\bigg)\bigg)^{-300}}{\bigg(\frac{0.049}{12}\bigg)}\bigg]\\
&= RM272,988.66\\
\\
CP &= A + DP\\
&= 272,988.66 + 35,000\\
&= RM307,988.66
\end{align}
\] b)
\[
\begin{align}
n = 6 \\
S &= R\bigg[\frac{(1 + i)^{n}-1}{i}\bigg]\\
&= 1,580\bigg[\frac{\bigg(1 + \bigg(\frac{0.049}{12}\bigg)\bigg)^{6}-1}{\bigg(\frac{0.049}{12}\bigg)}\bigg]\\
&= RM9,577.30
\end{align}
\]



n = 15 units
Invoice date = 11 Nov. 2020
Invoice = RM52,800 (Include Transportation = RM300)
LP = 52,800 - 300 = RM52,500
r_1 = 12%
r_2 = 10%
cash term = 9/10, 7/20, n/30

a)
\[
\begin{align}
SDER &= 1 - (1-r_1)(1-r_2)\\
&= 1 - (1-0.12)(1-0.1)\\
&= 1 - (0.88)(0.9)\\
&= 0.208\ @\ 20.8\%
\end{align}
\] b)
7/20 - 20 days after the invoice date 11 November 2020

11 Nov - 30 Nov = 19 days
Hence, last date to received 7% cash discount is on 1 December 2020

c)
Payment on 21 November 2020 (10 days from date of invoice)
Received 9% cash discount

\[
\begin{align}
Total\ Payment\ &= L(1-SDER)(1-cd)\ + Transport\\
&= 52,500(1-0.208)(1-0.09) + 300\\
&= RM38,137.80
\end{align}
\]



n = 200
TC = RM1,600 –> C = \(\frac{TC}{n} = RM8\)
NP = 30% on Selling Price –> NP = 0.3R
OE = 12% on Cost –> OE = 0.12C


\[
\begin{align}
R &= C + OE + NP\\
R &= C + 0.12C + 0.3R\\
R - 0.3R &= 1.12C\\
R &= \frac{1.12C}{0.7}\\
&= \frac{1.12(8)}{0.7}\\
&= RM12.80
\end{align}
\] b)


\[
\begin{align}
BEP &= C + OE\\
&= 1.2(8)\\
&= RM8.96\\
\\
Max\ MD\% &= \frac{R-BEP}{R}\times100\%\\
&= \frac{12.80 - 8.96}{12.8}\times100\%\\
&= 30\%\\
\\
or,\ Max\ MD\% &= \frac{NP}{R}\times100\%\\
\end{align}
\]






Note



The maximum percentage of markdown is equivalent to the NP% if the net profit is base on the selling price.





CP = RM3,000
DP = 0
n = 40 (weekly)
m = 52
r = 13% (original balance)

a)
\[
\begin{align}
I &= Brt\\
&= 3,000\ \times\ 0.13\ \times\ \frac{40}{52}\\
&= RM300
\end{align}
\] b)
\[
\begin{align}
R &= \frac{B+I}{n}\\
&= \frac{3,000 + 300}{40}\\
&= RM82.50
\end{align}
\] c)
\[
\begin{align}
N &= 40-30 = 10\\
n &= 40\\
\\
Outstanding\ Balance\ ,\ B &= RN-I\bigg[\frac{N(N+1)}{n(n+1)}\bigg]\\
&= 3,000(10)-300\bigg[\frac{10(10+1)}{40(40+1)}\bigg]\\
&= RM804.88
\end{align}
\]



C = RM12,500
n = 8 years
S = RM4,700
method = declining balance
\[
\begin{align}
r &= 1 - \sqrt[n]\frac{S}{C}\\
&= 1 - \sqrt[8]\frac{4,700}{12,500}\\
&= 0.1151\ @\ 11.51\%\\
\\
BV_4 &= C(1-r)^4\\
&= 12,500(1 - 0.1151)^4\\
&= RM7,664.85
\end{align}
\]
